title: Hey Cortana Microsofts assistant for Android goes hands-free with the latest update
text:
'Hey Cortana!' Microsoft's assistant for Android goes hands-free with the latest update 
PC World Sunday 25th October, 2015 
Android Central reported Friday afternoon that the latest release of the Cortana for Android beta will now listen to commands when you call its name. 
According to Android Central, as of version 1.0.0.289, you can get Cortana to listen for spoken commands simply by saying, "Hey Cortana"--a little like Google Now's "OK Google" and Siri's "Hey Siri" hand-free modes. All you need to do is go into Cortana's settings and make sure the "Hey Cortana" checkbox is ticked....
